Esta bien:
No recomiendo comprarlo de forma exclusiva. En mi caso por ejemplo,  lo compr√© al mismo tiempo que otros juegos de la saga, as√≠ que de alguna forma todos est√°n relacionados y lo puedes disfrutar por un rato al tomarlo como un extra de lo que anteriormente jugaste. 
Pero como juego independiente no vale mucho la pena, sobretodo por su escasez de jugadores en linea.
To samo co HL1 tylko sam multiplayer na silniku source :)
It's fun for a little while like any other old deathmatch game. I don't know how it appeared in my Steam library either.

Mise √† jour du mutlijoueur du premier Half-Life vers le moteur Source. Les graphismes ne reste pas trop d√©geu  et pour avoir jou√© √† celui du 2√®me opus, je trouve qui a plus d'armes sur ce jeu. On reste sur du match √† mort classique.

Mais avec la vingt√®ne de personnes r√©parti in√©galement sur maximum 5 serveurs sur 10 (noter aussi un jeu en anglais alors que le "remake" et le jeu original sont fran√ßais), je peux difficilement vous le recommander sachant que la base d'un jeu en ligne est d'avoir des joueurs pour jouer. Ce jeu reste un bonus de Half-Life : Source pour moi.

Great game with phenomenal fast-paced shooting. 

I've bought it for a number of friends for the full-price & it's mega worth it. 

I've played only eight hours in the past year, but I wish I played more. Servers are empty, but usually there's at least one dude playing. If I get two friends & I into a server then the player count usually doubles with random people entering and leaving. If you're interested in this or already play it, feel free to add me. I'm down to hop into this and if it's the right time I can get a couple pals in too. 

Modded servers are great too, lots of map variety, but even the vanilla maps have fun designs. Really refreshing to play DM like this in 2021.

This is just a pvp version of of Half Life 1 combat but with the source engine. Community is dead and anyone dedicated enough to play is probably a hacker or making a youtube video about it. It might be worth it to play with a bunch of friends but there are better games for that sort of thing. Still good because Half Life is good.
Un cl√°sico, m√°s a√∫n para jugar en la cuarentena con los panas.
classic even when its literal crap
A shame it isn't very popular as the gimmick is pretty good
bruh i need it for sandbox gmod

This is just normal Half-Life Deathmatch ported to Source. It's here, but there's not much too it. Most people are probably more familiar with the old version. This is only worth it as part of a bundle.
Cool. Has no deathmatch classic gamemodes and crashes frequently but other than that cool
Nice game but dead game. Nice to play with 5 players or just bots.

Theres a crack on my screen because of this game

Fix satchel charges

This game is quite fun but it's extremely glitchy. The long jump didn't even function, I walked on water, when I held Shift I walked and when I let go of it I started sprinting, I couldn't change my character and sometimes I would randomly take a few steps back without touching my keyboard even once. No, the game is not dead. You will see people on servers every now and then. Sure, they aren't choke-full, but they aren't abandoned either, however, that's not the problem. The problem are glitches that make the game unplayable.
Nothing else to say about half life game

i spam the nukes on crossfire

In my ongoing and likely futile effort to write a Steam review for every game in my library (#312 out of 612)... it's time for Half Life Deathmatch: Source.

Basically just the multiplayer mode of the original Half Life game, remade in Half Life 2's source engine. I'm not convinced it has much appeal beyond nostalgia, but if that's the itch you've got, it'll scratch it. Sadly I possess no such fond memories--my recollection of the original Half Life is almost exclusively with the fantastic single player mode.
Half life Classic Copy from Old Engine Paste to new engine
Very fun, great game and there are alive servers after how many years ?
It may be broken as all hell, but that's what makes it fun! At least it's less broken than HL:S was.

If you really love the original Half Life, then you may enjoy this.
Maybe to play for an hour,or two.Play with the old graphics,and use the classic old weapons.
But that's about it.
The problem is simple.The game is an antique at this point,and it has very few players.
Mostly dead.
If you got the game for free with a package.Try it if you like.
But it's not worth buying at this point.

this game is good. I even got an idea for a "cosplay gamemode" we could play in HL Death match! or, Half Death, as i like to call it. Zombies mode! it reqires no mods and revolves around skins: hl1 grunt vs zombies. zombies can only use crowbar, snarks, and explosive satual. zombie leader gets to use hive hand and lazer mine. humans only use mashine gun, grenades, lazer mines, rocket launcher, and gause gun. if a zombie kills a human, they are forced to change skin to zombie. oh, AND human leader has to have hev suit skin. die an elite, stay an elite! play this gamemode!!!
great addition to half life but its mostly dead idk why it even exists.
I can't really recommend anyone play this game when there's the newer version is out and on this one there doesn't seem to be any players
muy malo, los servidores super lentos
This game is very niiicce 10/10 IGN more people need to play
Fucking fantastic fun and absolute mayhem. Would absolutely recommend.
I love HL deathmatch games, but in this case, as with HL Source, Source engine just don't look natural on first HL

While I really love the nostalgia of this gem:
I just can't give this game a positive review.
This used to be a revolution, not anymore.
It's basically a dead game for your library.
You won't play it, since nobody is online.
Maybe with a friend or something, sure.
But there are better deathmatch games.
This was a great game, but now it's not.
You can just buy this for your collection.
Just look at the reviews, those playtimes.
Those positive reviews are just nostalgic.
I would like to give this a neutral review.
But steam does not do neutral reviews.

Just play og hl1 multiplayer this game is completely dead

Half Life in itself had a lot of death match-esque traits and features that would have made a great & fun deathmatch game, which it did at least in it's prime. Now that the player base has practically dwindled into a very low - non-existent player base as much as it is a fun game, and unless you like playing with bots, it is not fun without anyone to play with since it's in the name "deathmatch". With no players, it's as good as watching paint dry. It's a good game, ran out of life support.
